intro: Hieracium racolympicum subsp. lycopifoliopsis, commonly known as the Lycopifoliopsis hawkweed, is a rare and specialized plant species within the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive foliage, featuring leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow composite flowers, typical of the daisy family, which bloom in late summer. It is typically found in moist, calcareous soils in specific alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
